title.narrative: Local Government Management and Services Delivery Project

description.narrative: The objective of the Local Government Management and Services Delivery Project for Uganda is to strengthen the ability of the ministries, departments, agencies, and local governments to plan and manage resources in collaboration with communities for service delivery. This paper presents the background and rationale to (i) reallocate the unallocated credit proceeds and (ii) extend the closing date of the project by 12 months. Project disbursement as of June 21, 2011. The midterm review (MTR) which was conducted in November 2010 concluded that project implementation was on course and that the project will achieve its development objective. The extension is necessary to allow Government to complete the implementation of the planned project activities and in particular, to make up for the delays caused by parliamentary approval of the credit, which delayed the effectiveness of the credit by one year.

condition.narrative: Appointment of Procurement Auditors and Procurement Audits
The Recipient shall maintain, at all times until the completion of the Project, the Project Technical Committee
The Recipient shall through respective Local Governments, appraise, approve and monitor Subprojects, and administer the CommunityDriven Development Grants
The Recipient shall, not later than three months after the Effective Date, appoint to the Procurement Disposal Unit of the MoLG, aprocurement specialist acceptable to the Association
The Recipient shall, through respective Local Governments enter into a Subproject Agreement with each Community

title.narrative: Comp 2 - % of LGs which are collecting property rates for at least 60% of the valuation rolls

comment.narrative: The figure for Property Tax will be updated on receipt of the audited final account for FY2011/12 in March 2013.

title.narrative: % of LGs in the Northern Uganda meeting the minimum conditions to access the LDG

comment.narrative: 29 out of 40 Districts in the North met the minimum conditions and accessed the LDG.

title.narrative: % of Higher LGs registering at least 20% increase in own source revenue from the baseline year of 2005/06

comment.narrative: This indicator has a time lag of one FY since the source is the audited final accounts of LGs. The figure will be revised in March2013 when the audited final accounts for LGs are ready.

title.narrative: Comp 2 - % of LGs in Northern Uganda with at least 65% of the approved staffing filled

comment.narrative: This target may not be achieved due to proliferation of Districts.
This target drops to only 35% if assessed for all the 55 HLGs (including additional 11 newly created districts).

title.narrative: % of LGs which have computerized financial management system complete the final accounts within three months after the end of the fiscal year

comment.narrative: The number of HLGs reduced from 14 to 8 when KCCA with its 5 divisions became an Authority on March 1, 2012 and therefore ceasedtobe a LG, the number of "HLGs" for this indicator has been maintained to 14 since KCCA and its divisions are still benefiting fromthe IFMS support under the project. KCCA, its Divisions. All the remaining 8 LGs are completing final account within three monthsof the end of the FY.

title.narrative: Comp 2 - % of LLGs using the Harmonized Participatory Planning Guide (HPPG)

comment.narrative: This indicator reduces to 99.7% (1319 of 1323 LLGs) if the performances of the new LLGs are included.

title.narrative: Comp 1 - % of LGs that have been computerized for at least one year completing bank reconciliation in at least 1 months

comment.narrative: 8 out of 8 HLG computerized (excluding KCCA and its five Divisions) completing Bank reconciliation within two months.

title.narrative: At leat 75% of the LDG is invested in education, health, water and roads sectors, consistent with the PEAP

comment.narrative: Majority of LGs have continued to invest the LDG in the priority sectors of education, health, water and roads, consistent withGoUpolicy.
